name: Michael  Saylor
title: Founder & Executive Chairman
biography: Michael Saylor is the Executive Chairman of Strategy (MSTR), a publicly traded business intelligence firm & holder of ₿499,096 that he founded in 1989. He is also the founder of Alarm.com (ALRM), named inventor on 48+ patents, & author of the book “The Mobile Wave”. He founded the Saylor Academy (saylor.org), a non-profit that has provided free education to over 2 million students. He is an advocate for the Bitcoin Standard (hope.com) with dual degrees from MIT in Aerospace Engineering & History of Science. He posts his views on X @saylor and his website Michael.com. His 4 hour interview with Lex Fridman summarizes his thoughts on Bitcoin, Inflation, and the Future of Money with ~11 million views on YouTube.

name: CZ
title: Founder
biography: Founder of Binance

name: Michael Novogratz
title: CEO and Founder
biography: Michael Novogratz is the Founder and CEO of Galaxy Digital. He was formerly a Partner and President of Fortress Investment Group LLC. Prior to Fortress, Mr. Novogratz spent 11 years at Goldman Sachs, where he was elected Partner in 1998. Mr. Novogratz served on the New York Federal Reserve’s Investment Advisory Committee on Financial Markets from 2012 – 2015. Mr. Novogratz serves as the Chairman of The Bail Project and has made criminal justice reform a focus of his family’s foundation. He also sits on the Board of Overseers at NYU Langone Medical Center and is a board member of Princeton Varsity Club and Jazz Foundation of America. Mr. Novogratz received an AB in Economics from Princeton University and served as a helicopter pilot in the US Army.

name: H.E. Dr. Mohamed Al Kuwaiti
title: Head of Cyber Security, United Arab Emirates Government
biography: H.E. Dr. Mohamed Al Kuwaiti is the Head of Cyber Security for the UAE Government and leads the UAE Cyber Security Council. He oversees the national cybersecurity strategy, resilience programs, and major initiatives that positioned the UAE among the top-ranked countries in the ITU Global Cybersecurity Index 2024. He also serves as Managing Director of the National Data Center and plays key international roles, including Co-Chair of the Counter Ransomware Initiative and Vice Chair of OIC-CERT. Dr. Al Kuwaiti has over 20 years of experience in national security and has spoken at more than 50 global events. He holds a Ph.D. in Computer Engineering and Network Security from George Washington University.

name: Paul Manafort
title: Former Campaign Manager
biography: Paul Manafort is a seasoned political strategist and consultant with decades of experience in navigating complex geopolitical landscapes. As a former chairman of a major U.S. presidential campaign, he has a deep understanding of the intersection between politics, economics, and emerging technologies. In recent years, Paul has taken a keen interest in the potential of Bitcoin and blockchain technology to transform the global financial system. He brings a unique perspective on the role of cryptocurrency in fostering financial independence and decentralization. Paul’s insights offer a valuable blend of traditional financial expertise and a forward-looking view on the disruptive power of digital assets, making him a compelling voice at the forefront of the Bitcoin revolution.

name: Ahmed Bin Sulayem
title: Executive Chairman & CEO
biography: Ahmed Bin Sulayem is the Executive Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of DMCC and has driven its growth from a start-up of 28 member companies in 2003 to the world’s leading international business district in 2025 with over 25,000 member companies from 180 countries, employing over 80,000 people.Tasked with enhancing commodity trade flows through Dubai, DMCC has introduced to the market a number of value-added products and services under Mr Bin Sulayem’s leadership. In 2023, DMCC was named ‘Global Free Zone of the Year’ by The Financial Times fDi Magazine, for a record ninth consecutive year.Mr Bin Sulayem oversaw the exponential growth of the DMCC Free Zone master development in Jumeirah Lakes Towers (JLT), a 200-hectare business and residential community in Dubai of over 100,000 people living and working in 87 towers. Mr Bin Sulayem also oversees the development of DMCC’s latest real estate project, the Uptown Dubai district.Mr Bin Sulayem currently serves as the Chairman of the Dubai Diamond Exchange (DDE) and the Dubai Gold & Commodities Exchange (DGCX).The Kimberley Process officially appointed the United Arab Emirates (UAE) as the first and only Arab country to Chair the Kimberley Process (KP) in November 2015. Shortly after, the UAE Ministry of Economy officially appointed Mr Bin Sulayem as the UAE’s Chair of the KP for 2016. Mr Bin Sulayem was reappointed Chair of the KP for a historic second time in 2024 and has continued his leadership role with the position of Custodian Chair of the KP in 2025.CV – DMCC• 2001 – Joined DMCC• 2002 – Appointed Chief Operating Officer (COO)• 2007 – Appointed Executive Chairman• 2019 – Appointed Chief Executive Officer (CEO)

name: Simon Dixon
title: CEO & Co-Founder
biography: Simon Dixon has always considered himself a finance geek—obsessed with banking, monetary reform and geo-financial analysis that shape our world. After building a career as an insider in investment banking—as a stockbroker, market maker, and corporate finance banker—he developed a rare understanding of how the financial system really works. But when his father lost everything in the dot-com bust, Simon left his lucrative career behind to become a monetary reformer, determined not just to expose the flaws of finance but to fix them.That mission led him to Bitcoin when it was just $3—a moment that changed everything. Unlike most early adopters who were tech enthusiasts, Simon came from finance, and he decoded what Satoshi left behind: Bitcoin was not just money, but the tool that could end the corrupt financial system, dismantle the Federal Reserve, and strip power from those who abuse it. He saw how politicians and regulators would deliberately co-opt innovation to maintain control—something he experienced first-hand when his attempts to reform the UK banking system were blocked.With that foresight, Simon gained financial freedom through Bitcoin and became one of the earliest investors in the industry’s biggest names—including Coinbase, Kraken, BitPay, Bitfinex, Blockchain.com, Circle and Robinhood. He is also the author of *Bank to the Future* (2012), the world’s first published book to ever discuss Bitcoin.Recognized by Robert Kiyosaki as “the first guy to ever talk about Bitcoin,” praised by Richard Branson for his investment platform BnkToTheFuture.com, and called by Max Keiser “the No.1 Bitcoin investment banker ever,” Simon has long been ahead of his time. Through BnkToTheFuture, he has facilitated over $2.5 billion of investments into companies that shaped the Bitcoin ecosystem.He has helped thousands become Bitcoin millionaires and billionaires—and now seeks to help millions more protect themselves, their families, and their nations from an AI-driven jobless future and the oppressive control of central bank digital currencies (CBDCs)—with Bitcoin as the tool for freedom and protection.Simon is widely recognized not only for his pioneering role in Bitcoin but also for his expertise in geo-financial analysis, money, and investing. His ability to connect Bitcoin, macroeconomics, and global financial power shifts has allowed him to anticipate trends and events years before they unfold—making him the person many influencers and analysts quietly study.Through his weekly show BitcoinHardTalk (100k+ YouTube subscribers, 200k+ followers on X), Simon helps people follow the money, self-custody their Bitcoin, and resist an oppressive financial system whose time is running out.

name: Abdulla Al Dhaheri
title: CEO
biography: Abdulla Al Dhaheri is the CEO of The Blockchain Center Abu Dhabi, leading the UAE’s flagship hub for digital asset innovation. He has played an instrumental role in bringing tier-1 global exchanges and market makers to Abu Dhabi, collaborating closely with regulators and sovereign stakeholders to build the UAE’s leadership in digital assets, AI, and tokenized finance. Abdulla previously advised multi-billion-dollar companies on public listings and digital asset adoption, and has been invited to speak at global conferences for his contributions to decentralized technologies. Today, he continues to invest strategically through The Blockchain Center Fund, scaling global digital asset ventures and sovereign-grade digital asset infrastructures from Abu Dhabi to the world.

name: Saifedean Ammous
title: Author
biography: Saifedean is an economist and the author of the best-selling book, The Bitcoin Standard. as well as The Fiat Standard, The Gold Standard, and Principles of Economics. He teaches economics on his online learning platform saifedean.com and hosts The Bitcoin Standard Podcast.

name: John Koudounis
title: President and CEO
biography: John Koudounis serves as the President and CEO of Calamos Investments, the third largest liquid alternatives asset manager in the US. Under his leadership, the firm’s AUM has surged to over $46 billion, nearly tripling since he took the helm in 2016. Notably, he has overseen the launch of innovative products, including the world's first suite of downside-protected Bitcoin ETFs.With over 37 years of experience in the financial services sector, he previously held the position of President and CEO at Mizuho Securities in the Americas, where he significantly expanded the firm's capital markets teams and enhanced profitability, client base, and product diversity, elevating Mizuho to a top-tier global investment bank.In addition to his corporate responsibilities, Koudounis is recognized for his thought leadership, frequently speaking at global conferences and platforms such as CNBC, Fox Business, and Bloomberg TV. Koudounis is committed to philanthropy and is involved with several organizations including the Concordia Leadership Council, the SEAL Future Foundation, The Hellenic Initiative, and the Ecumenical Bartholomew Foundation.He holds a degree in International Diplomacy & Foreign Affairs and Economics from Brown University.

name: Marwan Al Zarouni
title: CEO
biography: Dr. Marwan Al Zarouni is a global Bitcoin and blockchain advocate driving Dubai’s digital innovation agenda. As CEO of the Dubai Blockchain Center, he has led regional efforts in Bitcoin education, adoption, and policy development. Recognized among CoinTelegraph’s Top 100 Most Influential Figures in Blockchain and Cryptocurrencies (2022), he also served on the World Economic Forum’s Global Future Council on Cryptocurrencies. Through his leadership, Dr. Al Zarouni continues to position Dubai as a global hub for blockchain and Bitcoin innovation.

name: Bilal  Bin Saqib
title: CEO
company: Minister of State for Blockchain and Crypto in Pakistan
biography: Bilal Bin Saqib is the CEO of the Pakistan Crypto Council, a government-backed advisory body accelerating crypto regulation and driving innovation across Pakistan’s digital asset landscape. He also serves as Chief Advisor to the Finance Minister of Pakistan.Named in Forbes 30 Under 30 and honored as a Member of the British Empire by King Charles III, Bilal is a force where conviction meets code. With ventures across Web2 and Web3, and a social media following of over 700,000, he’s part builder, part crypto diplomat — using Bitcoin not just as a technology, but as a tool for economic independence and, financial inclusion. Additionally, Bilal is also an advisor to the Trump-family backed DeFi project, World Liberty Financial.

name: Aaron  van Wirdum
biography: Aaron van Wirdum is the technical editor for Bitcoin Magazine and the cohost of the Bitcoin, Explained podcast. With a background in studying the historical influence of society-shaping technologies, he’s been covering Bitcoin and related projects since 2013. He is known for his ability to explain highly-technical subjects to a layman audience and specializes in topics including Bitcoin’s history, scaling and privacy technology.

name: Aaron Daniel
title: Co-founder
biography: Cofounder of Resolvr, an insurtech bridging the global insurance market to Bitcoin. Published author for Bitcoin Magazine and the Satoshi Papers.

name: Abderrahman Ghiadi
title: Head of Mining Pool (MENA)
biography: 10+ years' background in Investments / Bitcoin mining for HNWIs & Institutions. He is also conducting research as a PhD researcher in Economics focusing on Bitcoin, Bitcoin mining, and Energy Economics using stranded or curtailed energy sources, and the development of competitive mining pool services for medium-size to large miners in the MEA region

name: Abdumalik Mirakhmedov
title: Executive President
biography: Abdumalik Mirakhmedov is Executive President of GDA, one of the world’s largest and most experienced Bitcoin mining companies, with a track record of building, managing, and scaling data center operations spanning nearly a decade.GDA champions innovation, responsible energy use, and investment in the communities where it operates globally, including 20 data centres across North America, South America, Europe, and Central Asia.With a total power capacity of over 600 MW, the company has brought over 180,000 miners online. GDA is committed to supporting the infrastructure for the future of money by making the bitcoin network more robust, resilient, and secure.

name: Abu Akkuc
title: Founder & Creative Director
biography: Abu Akkuc is the founder and Creative Director of 21Million Fashion (Bitcoin fashion brand). With his brand, he demonstrates that Bitcoin is far more than a financial instrument – it is a cultural movement that inspires a new way of thinking. His collections carry the spirit of “Proof of Work”: discipline, perseverance, and authenticity are reflected in every detail. For him, fashion becomes a medium that makes freedom, independence, and creativity tangible.Under the umbrella of 21Million Fashion, Abu has also created a high-fashion subbrand, Orange Elite, which combines the highest quality standards with elegance and the rebellious energy of Bitcoin.Beyond his role as an entrepreneur, Abu is deeply committed to promoting Bitcoin education. He conveys the cultural, social, and philosophical dimensions of Bitcoin, making it clear that it’s not just about money, but about a new understanding of responsibility and self-determination. His work blends style with substance, showing how Bitcoin is shaping our culture and mindset in lasting ways.

name: Adam Haynes
title: Founder & CEO
biography: Founder & CEO of Simple Mining. We sell, host, and repair Bitcoin miners with the goal of making Bitcoin mining simple, accessible, and profitable for everyone.

name: Adam O'Brien
title: Founder and CEO
biography: Adam is a husband, father of four and a bitcoin entrepreneur on a mission to enable independence. Since founding Bitcoin Well in 2013, Adam has made it easy to buy, sell and use bitcoin both online in the bitcoin-only portal, and in person at Bitcoin ATMs across Canada. Today, Bitcoin Well is a publicly traded organization (BTCW)

name: Adam Schneider
title: CEO
biography: Adam Schneider, better known as “Seccour,” is a prominent figure in the Bitcoin community, especially in the UAE. He discovered Bitcoin in December 2012 at the age of 16, while still in high school. Having lived in Dubai since 2010, Seccour later pursued cybersecurity studies at university, which deepened his understanding of Bitcoin’s underlying technology.Since 2017, he has organized the Dubai Bitcoin Meetup, fostering a community dedicated to learning about and engaging with Bitcoin. His work focuses on advocating for Bitcoin in the UAE and developing tools that contribute to the evolving Bitcoin landscape.

name: Alain Kunz
title: MD, Head of Business Development
biography: Alain Kunz is a Managing Director at GSR, where he leads Business Development for the firm - a global leader in digital asset trading and market structure, and a key capital markets partner to the crypto industry.Prior to joining GSR, Mr. Kunz founded several ventures in the financial services and digital asset sectors. He has also advised public and private institutions, political leaders, and high-net-worth individuals, focusing on the intersection of innovation, finance, technology, and societal impact.Mr. Kunz began his career at UBS Investment Bank after graduating from the University of St. Gallen (HSG). His career reflects a consistent commitment to bridging traditional finance and emerging technologies in an increasingly digital economy.

name: Alan Lane
title: Advisor
biography: Former CEO of Silvergate Bank. Silvergate began banking the bitcoin industry in 2014.

name: Alejandro de la Torre
title: CEO & Co-Founder
biography: Former VP & Co-Founder of BTC.com & Poolin bitcoin mining pools. Activated Taproot via miner-activated-softfork. 10 + years in bitcoin mining. Currently CEO & Co-Founder of DMND the first fully StratumV2 Bitcoin Mining Pool.

name: Aleksandar Svetski
title: Founder CEO
biography: Alex Svetski is an Author and Entrepreneur.Aleksandar is the Author of the best selling “UnCommunist Manifesto” and the "Bushido of Bitcoin”. He is building the Nostr-enabled Social Network for Sovereign Individuals: Satlantis.ioPreviously, he launched the world’s first Bitcoin-only savings app: Amber, and open sourced The Spirit of Satoshi, a Bitcoin-centric LLM.

name: Alex Bodromian
title: Chief Operating Officer
biography: Alex is a seasoned professional in the financial services industry with a proven track record in business development, client relationship management, and strategic planning. His expertise lies in driving growth and delivering exceptional value to clients.

name: Alex Recouso
title: Co-founder & CEO
biography: Alex Recouso is the co-founder and CEO of CitizenX, the world's first citizenship market. CitizenX has assisted countless Bitcoiners and their families in diversifying their passport portfolios, providing greater optionality, sovereignty, and freedom. He also advises nation-states on designing and implementing citizenship and residency programs to accumulate Bitcoin in budget-neutral ways.

name: Alexander Neumüller
title: Research Associate
company: Cambridge Judge Business School, Univeristy of Cambridge
biography: Alexander is a Research Associate at the Cambridge Centre for Alternative Finance (CCAF), where he leads the Cambridge Digital Assets Programme’s research efforts on the climate impact of digital assets. Drawing on extensive practical experience within the crypto ecosystem – from cryptocurrency mining to engaging with DeFi protocols – he brings deep domain expertise to his work. Prior to joining the CCAF, Alexander held various roles in traditional finance, including corporate banking, proprietary trading, and asset management. He holds a Master’s degree in Finance from Cambridge Judge Business School, University of Cambridge, and an MBA from Johannes Kepler Universität Linz. Alexander is widely regarded as an expert on the environmental footprint of cryptocurrency mining, and his insights are frequently featured in leading media outlets such as Bloomberg, Fox News, Reuters, and The Financial Times.

name: Alexander Sayegh
title: Co-Founder & CTO
biography: An early advocate for Blockchain technology and Bitcoin specifically, focusing on spreading the knowledge, sharing expertise and providing technical consulting, I've made Bitcoin and Blockchain my career for a good reason, I have a lot to contribute to it, the skill to teach people about it and the technical depth of advising on strategy, technology and integration with rest of the world.With my deep technical foundation and a strong belief in Bitcoin’s transformative potential, I focus on building scalable mining and cloud solutions that empower individuals and enterprises alike.

name: Alexandre Laizet
title: Board Director of Bitcoin Strategy
biography: Alexandre is Board Member and Director of Bitcoin Strategy at Capital B, Europe’s first Bitcoin Treasury Company. Alexandre is a committed Bitcoin maximalist.

name: Ali Alnuaimi
title: Founder
biography: Ali Alnuaimi founded Shafra and stands at the crossroads of energy, technology, and digital assets in the UAE. Once a nuclear engineer who launched the nation's first reactor and sat on the UAE Space Agency board, he left the public sector to advance Bitcoin as a strategic energy play. Today he counsels government leaders, sovereign wealth funds, and giants such as MARA on Bitcoin policy, energy efficiency, and industrial-scale mining. A founding adviser to the Sui protocol and partner to several others, he channels deep expertise and wide connections to unite government, legacy industries, and emerging AI-driven tech, securing lasting value through intellectual, political, and financial capital.

name: Alisia Painter
title: Co-Founder and COO
biography: Alisia Painter is the COO and Co-Founder of Botanix Labs, the team behind Botanix, the Bitcoin-based blockchain unlocking Bitcoin Finance. With over a decade of experience in Ethereum and an MBA from Harvard Business School, Alisia is a Bitcoiner at heart, focused on expanding Bitcoin’s programmability and bringing yield-bearing assets like stBTC to market.She has been featured in CNBC, Forbes, Schwab Network, Kitco News, and CoinDesk TV, sharing insights on Bitcoin’s evolution from digital gold to financial infrastructure, and regularly speaks at leading industry conferences on the future of decentralized finance and institutional adoption.

name: Allen Farrington
title: CEO
biography: Writer and Investor, coauthor of Bitcoin Is Venice and Only The Strong Survive, cofounder and General Partner at Axiom, cofounder and CEO at Flux

name: Allen Helm
title: Director of Business Development
biography: Allen Helm co-founded Bitcoin for Corporations (BFC) in 2024, a joint initiative between Strategy (formerly MicroStrategy) and BTC Inc., where he now serves as Director of Business Development & Client Services. He leads product execution, client success, and business development, working with corporate treasuries, service providers, and capital allocators to accelerate global Bitcoin adoption.Previously, he scaled enterprise partnerships at Bitcoin Magazine and The Bitcoin Conference.

name: Alphonse Mehounme
title: CEO
biography: Alphonse is Co-founder and CEO of Flash, a platform that is helping people in Francophone Africa access Bitcoin easily and opt out of fiat. He also contributes to Bitcoin education through local initiatives and participate in conferences to share insights.

name: Andrej Majcen
title: Group CEO & Co-Founder
biography: Andrej Majcen is the Co-Founder and Group Chief Executive Officer of Bitcoin Suisse, Switzerland’s leading and longest-established crypto-financial services firm. He co-founded the company in 2013, when Bitcoin was still nascent and Ethereum had yet to launch, and has since guided its growth into a major international brand—Switzerland’s largest custodian and one of the world’s foremost staking operators.Over the past decade, Andrej has held several senior leadership roles at Bitcoin Suisse, including Head of Global Expansion and Strategic Clients, before being appointed Group CEO in 2024. In recognition of his contributions to the blockchain and fintech industry, he was named to the Forbes 30 Under 30 DACH list in 2020.A frequent speaker at blockchain and finance conferences around the world, Andrej is a strong advocate for the transformative potential of digital assets to build a more inclusive, efficient, and resilient global economy.

name: Andrew Hohns
title: CEO
biography: Andrew Hohns, PhD., Founder & Chief Executive Officer. Dr. Hohns founded Newmarket in 2020 and Battery Finance in 2022. He has overseen transaction structuring for approximately $50 billion of notional risk transfer. He has been a regular speaker at various industry conferences, with expertise in topics related to securitization, bitcoin, socially responsible investment, impact investment, infrastructure, and development finance. Prior to founding Newmarket, Dr. Hohns served as Managing Director at Mariner Investment Group from 2012 through 2020 and as Managing Director at Cohen & Company until 2012. Additionally, Dr. Hohns was an Adjunct Assistant Professor at New York University’s Stern School of Business from 2012 to 2015. He holds a BS in Economics from the Wharton School at the University of Pennsylvania (2000), a Masters in Liberal Arts from the School of Arts and Sciences at the University of Pennsylvania (2006), and a PhD in Applied Economics and Managerial Sciences from the Wharton School at the University of Pennsylvania (2012). Dr. Hohns is a member of the Board of Directors of Fold Holdings Group (NASDAQ:FLD), Bitcoin Development Corporation, Inc (NASDAQ: BDCIU), and UNICEF USA.

name: Andrew Vranjes
title: Chief Revenue Officer
biography: Andrew is driving Blockdaemon’s global growth strategy as Chief Revenue Officer (CRO). In this role, he is responsible for driving and aligning all revenue generating processes across the organization. Previously, Andrew was VP and GM at APAC, where he has successfully led regional growth, forged strategic partnerships, and expanded market presence in the Asia Pacific Region. Prior to joining Blockdaemon, Andrew has held leadership roles in Amazon Web Services (AWS), Cisco Systems and Singtel/Optus. In AWS, Andrew built out the teams focussed on Startups, Digital Natives, Crypto/Fintech and AWS’s partnerships with the Venture Capital and Private Equity community. In Cisco, Andrew led sales and Business Development for several acquisitions and internally built software solutions, most notably the GTM in APAC for an acquisition, tail-f systems. In Optus Business, Andrew led and owned the P&L for the Data Centre and Cloud Practice.

name: Anish Shivdasani
title: Head of Digital Assets
biography: Dr Anish Shivdasani is Head of Digital Assets at Roland Berger, where he has advised exchanges, banks, bitcoin mines and sovereign wealth funds on a range of strategic matters

name: Anthony Scaramucci
title: Founder and Managing Partner
biography: Anthony Scaramucci is the founder and managing partner of SkyBridge, a global alternative investment firm, and founder and chairman of SALT, a global thought leadership forum and venture studio.He is co-host of two podcasts, “The Rest Is Politics US” and “Open Book,” and author of six books, including most recently “The Little Book of Bitcoin.”Prior to founding SkyBridge in 2005, Scaramucci co-founded investment partnership Oscar Capital Management, which was sold to Neuberger Berman in 2001. Earlier, he worked in Private Wealth Management at Goldman Sachs & Co.In 2022, Scaramucci was ranked #47 in Cointelegraph’s Top 100 Influencers in Crypto and Blockchain. In 2016, he was ranked #85 in Worth Magazine’s Power 100: The 100 Most Powerful People in Global Finance. In 2011, he received Ernst & Young’s New York Financial Services “Entrepreneur of the Year” Award and is a member of the Council on Foreign Relations (CFR).Scaramucci served on President Donald J. Trump’s Presidential Transition Team Executive Committee in 2016 before serving briefly as White House Communications Director.Scaramucci, a native of Long Island, New York, holds a Bachelor of Arts degree in Economics from Tufts University and a Juris Doctor from Harvard Law School.

name: Areeb Ahmad
title: Senior Associate
biography: Areeb Ahmad tells the story of Bitcoin through the lens of law, power, and technology. Based in Dubai, he advises crypto exchanges and fintechs on licensing and compliance, while questioning how institutions, AI, and tokenization are rewriting the rules of money itself.

name: Arjun Sethi
title: co-CEO
biography: Arjun Sethi serves as Co-CEO of Kraken, one of the world’s largest,longest-standing and most secure cryptocurrency platforms.Arjun is widely recognized as one of the top early-stage ventureinvestors in Silicon Valley, as well as a successful founder andoperator.He is also Co-Founder and Chairman of Tribe Capital, a top venture capital firm focused on capturing a perpetual edge in venture and crypto using artificial intelligence and data science. Some of his noteworthy investments include xAI, Rippling, Applied Intuition, Slack, Gusto, Swarm (Sold to SpaceX), Shiprocket and Carta. Arjun was previously a Partner at Social Capital where he led the Venture Team focusing on early stage investing in the consumer and enterprise sector.Prior to his work in venture, Arjun co-founded and sold two successful software companies – LOLapps and MessageMe. LOLapps was acquired by 6waves to become the second largest game publisher on Facebook, and Arjun served as Chief Product Officer. His second company MessageMe was acquired by Yahoo, and Arjun subsequently joined Marissa Mayer’s executive team, where he led data and analytics teams and ran mobile and emerging products. He also served as a Board Observer on Alibaba.Arjun has a long track record of seeding, incubating, and growing investments - including as Co-Founder at Termina.ai, an AI-powered analytics platform used by leading institutional investors to diligence private market investments.He is also a Co-Founder at Kapital (AI powered software platform and bank), Ashvattha (platform for small molecule therapeutics), Foundation (humanoid robots), Ironfist (precision-targeted pharmaceutical treatment for tumors) and Nanopower Therapeutics (anti-inflammatory nanomedicine).

name: Arsh Molu
title: Operations Lead
biography: Arsh Molu champions financial freedom at the Human Rights Foundation, an organization dedicated to defending human rights in authoritarian regimes. Arsh is also the Co-founder of Generation Bitcoin and the Bitcoin Students Network, worldwide communities that support younger generations in learning about Bitcoin, cultivating the next generation of Bitcoin leaders.

name: Austin Alexander
title: Partner
biography: Austin Alexander discovered Bitcoin in 2011 while working at an economic policy think tank in Washington D.C. in 2013 he co-founded the New York Bitcoin Center, the world's first physical Bitcoin exchange. Austin served as the industries first sales executive when he joined kraken in 2014. From 2019-2022 he served as Krakens CEO for the Middle East in the first licensed exchange in the UAE. He is now a partner at 10x Capital

name: Belyï Nobel KUBWAYO
title: Founder & Director
biography: Belyi is a Burundian Bitcoiner, economist, and social entrepreneur with a passion for technology and financial autonomy. He is the founder of BTC Shule, an initiative that educates Burundians on Bitcoin through meetups and online training, building a circular economy to foster financial autonomy in Gitega. He has been instrumental in building community-based Bitcoin adoption projects in rural areas and regularly advocates for financial autonomy through Bitcoin.Belyï holds several Bitcoin certifications, including the renowned Certified Bitcoin Professional (CBP), Sailor Academy, and Crack The Orange, solidifying his expertise in Bitcoin education and adoption. In addition to his advocacy work, he is also writing a book that explores Bitcoin’s potential in Africa, presenting it through African realities to resonate with and empower the continent’s youth.

name: Benjamin de Waal
title: Chief Technology Officer
biography: Discovered Bitcoin in 2010. Stopped holding fiat in 2017. Resume includes Northern Bitcoin, Lightning Labs, Swan, and more. Currently laser-focused on Merchant Adoption at Musqet.

name: Bill Qian
title: Founder
biography: Bill Qian – Founder, Investor, & Thought LeaderBill Qian is a global investor, entrepreneur, and thought leader shaping the future of crypto, AI, and fintech. With a track record of over $30 billion in investments, he has played a key role in backing and scaling transformative technologies worldwide.Currently, Bill is the Co-Founder of Cypher Capital, a leading multi-strategy investment firm focused on blockchain and Web3.Previously, Bill was the Global Head of M&A and Binance Labs at Binance, where he managed the world's largest crypto investment portfolio at the time—$25 billion. Prior to that, he led fintech and AI investments at JD.com, overseeing investments in a business that generated over $400 billion in gross merchandise volume (GMV).Beyond investing, Bill is a passionate advocate for the convergence of AI, blockchain, and digital finance. He shares insights through his podcast, “Where AI Meets Crypto, Technology Meets Humanity, and East Meets West,” featuring top industry voices on emerging trends.

name: Billy Boone
title: Director of Market Research
biography: Market Research at Simple Mining. Founder of The Bitcoin Mining Investor Letter.

name: Borja Martel Seward
title: Co-Founder & CEO
biography: Building Bitcoin's Wall Street

name: Brandon Green
title: CEO
biography: Brandon is CEO of BTC Inc. Since joining the Company in 2017, Green has been a core member of BTC Inc, holding a variety of leadership roles including Managing Director, Chief of Staff, and Head of Events. During his tenure, he has helped drive the global expansion of the Bitcoin Conference franchise beyond the United States to Amsterdam, Hong Kong, and Abu Dhabi.

name: Brett Tejpaul
title: Co-CEO Institutional
biography: Brett Tejpaul serves as Co-CEO of Coinbase Institutional, leading Coinbase’s efforts to build a trusted bridge for institutions expanding their crypto strategies. In this role, he spearheads the growth of the institutional client base, develops sophisticated features and services tailored to institutional investors, and drives industry-wide education and innovation on digital assets.Brett brings deep expertise from traditional finance, having previously served as Global Head of Sales at Barclays and held senior leadership positions at JP Morgan. His unique combination of institutional markets experience and global crypto innovation enables him to deliver integrated solutions that seamlessly connect custody, advanced trading platforms, and prime services for the world's leading institutions.Brett holds a Bachelor of Science degree from Boston College.

name: Brian Dixon
title: CEO
biography: Brian is the CEO of Off the Chain Capital, which is a Warren Buffet value-style investment firm focused on acquiring blockchain assets at a discount. He is the author of four books covering Bitcoin and advanced technology. He entered the Bitcoin space in 2012 and has traveled the world educating people on the importance of the technology and asset.

name: Brindon Mwiine
title: Founder
biography: Brindon Mwiine is the Founder of Bitcoin Kampala Uganda, driving real-world Bitcoin adoption in Uganda through Bitcoin education, circular-economy initiatives, and paying teachers in sats. He is also Co-Founder of Gorilla Sats, which fuses Bitcoin with adventure tourism across Uganda.

name: Bruce Fenton
title: CEO
biography: Bruce is CEO of the investment holding company Chainstone Labs. Bruce has been full time in Bitcoin since 2013 when he was Executive Director of the Bitcoin Foundation. He has over 30 years financial and investing experience and owns Atlantic Financial, a Registered Investment Advisor. Fenton is a liberty and free market advocate and ran for US Senate for New Hampshire in 2022. Fenton is the host of the Satoshi Roundtable, now in its 12th year, an annual event bringing together leading Founders, CEOs, and developers in the fintech and Bitcoin ecosystem.

name: Carl Moon
title: CEO & Founder
biography: Carl Runefelt is a prominent Bitcoin maximalist and entrepreneur who through his media presence, investments, and leadership in the crypto space - Promotes widespread Bitcoin adoption while encouraging others to adopt a long-term, conviction in Bitcoin as the foundation of the new financial era.

name: Carlos Estrada
title: CEO & Founder
biography: Carlos Estrada is a Bitcoin entrepreneur and the founder of Coin Vigilante, a company creating limited-edition Bitcoin-inspired timepieces that embody scarcity, precision, and proof-of-work. He is also the founder of Vigilante Media, a full-service marketing agency helping brands grow through storytelling, creative strategy, and digital innovation. In addition, Carlos leads Venture Watches, a B2B watch manufacturing company that provides end-to-end design and production solutions for brands and organizations worldwide. His work connects the worlds of Bitcoin, craftsmanship, and entrepreneurship—driven by a belief in sound money, creativity, and building lasting value.

name: Carly B
title: Head of VIP & Strategic Partnerships
biography: Carly Benson is the Head of VIP & Strategic Partnerships for the Bitcoin Conference and has been running the Whale Pass experience since 2021.Carly became a Bitcoin-only Bitcoiner in 2017 after living in Las Vegas and interacting with the professional poker and sports betting community. She learned about Bitcoin by seeing use-cases for it as the whales of the gambling world have been betting, settling and transacting in BTC for many years.Before getting in to the Bitcoin space, Carly ran her own successful marketing consultancy for 18 years and was known as an alcohol-free SME, Course Creator and Yoga Instructor.She has given talks around the world and her work and courses have helped thousands change their relationship with alcohol. She’s been featured in Women’s Health, SELF magazine, Extra TV, Travel Zoo and other notable outlets.

name: Charlene Fadirepo
title: CEO
biography: Charlene Fadirepo is the founder and CEO of Mango Digital Strategies, a Bitcoin education and consulting firm dedicated to helping finance professionals and mission-driven organizations unlock the potential of Bitcoin and digital assets. With 15+ years of expertise in finance, regulation, and strategic innovation, Charlene has guided corporate clients in integrating Bitcoin into their business models—whether through treasury management optimization, business practices, or exploring Bitcoin mining opportunities. Charlene is the creator of the popular course for finance professionals, BitcoinTreasuryCourse.com. Charlene is also the author of The Bitcoin Leap: How Bitcoin Is Transforming Africa. Charlene studied Electrical Engineering at the University of Virginia and earned a Masters In Business Administration from The Fuqua School of Business at Duke University.

name: Charlie Hu
title: Co-founder
biography: Charlie Hu is an entrepreneur and investor with a long tenure in the crypto space. He bought his first bitcoin in 2013 and since then he has been actively involved in the crypto spaces holding key positions in Polkadot, Tezos and Polygon.He is an active proponent of Bitcoin DeFi and scalability, believing that the largest liquidity unlock potential remains to be seen.Currently he is the the Cofounder of Bitlayer, a Bitcoin Layer 2 supercharging BitcoinDefi through YBTC and BitVM technology, a third generation bridging solution.Charlie is an active public speaker having participated in panels and delivering keynotes participated in Korea Blockchain Week, Bitcoin Nashville, Bitcoin Asia, Consensus. He is regularly featured in top media such as Cointelegraph, Coindesk, Bitcoin.com, Forbes amongst others.He is also a key connector between east and west unlocking opportunities between Asia retail communities and large investors and institutions in the US.

name: Chris Lane
title: Partner
biography: Began learning about Bitcoin in 2013 while working at Silvergate Bank. Have worked at the intersection of Bitcoin, Digital Assets, and US Commercial Banking for the past 12 years.

name: Chris MMCrypto
title: Owner
biography: Bitcoin Content Creator for more than 8 Years.Biggest Public Bitcoin Trade open.Biggest Bitcoin only Audience on YouTube

name: Christian Lopez
title: Managing Director, Head of Blockchain and Digital Assets
biography: Christian has dedicated his career to the Fintech and financial services sectors, developing a unique expertise in M&A, venture capital, capital markets, SPAC, and private placement transactions. His passion for sound money and its transformative impact on the financial ecosystem drives his work.Currently, Christian is Managing Director, Head of Blockchain and Digital Assets at Cohen & Company Capital Markets. Previously, he served as Vice President at Broadhaven Capital Partners, providing M&A and private placement advisory services to blockchain and Fintech companies. Before that, he was an Associate at Guggenheim Securities, covering Fintech, Banks, Insurance, and Specialty Finance, with a keen interest in blockchain innovations.Christian holds an MBA from Columbia Business School and a BS from the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign.

name: Christoph Koster
title: CEO
biography: Chris has been building financial services and investment platforms for banks, governments and technology companies. He is currently serving as the CEO of ruya, the UAE’s digital-first Islamic community bank. Under his leadership, ruya is dedicated to creating a fairer and more sustainable world through ethical Islamic banking practices, exceptional customer service and active community engagement.Before his role at ruya, Chris served as the Chief Operating Officer at a G42 joint venture, where he was responsible for building the business unit from its incubation phase. He also led the asset management of the group's portfolio of operating businesses and developed its proprietary investment programme.Prior to G42, Chris was a key member of the executive management team at the Abu Dhabi Investment Office (ADIO). His leadership and strategic vision were vital in positioning Abu Dhabi as a significant player on the global investment stage.At Emirates NBD, Chris led award-winning strategy and customer experience teams across Private Banking, Asset Management and Retail Banking. His tenure saw Emirates NBD's Private Banking business rise to prominence as the leading wealth management franchise in the region.Chris's career began at Roland Berger’s restructuring and turnaround practice as well as the corporate development and M&A team at a major renewable energy conglomerate.

name: Clarisse Hagege
title: CEO
biography: Clarisse Hagège is the CEO of Dfns, a cybersecurity company securing Bitcoin and digital assets through advanced wallet infrastructure. Her work focuses on building the cryptographic and institutional rails that enable safe, programmable custody and transaction flows across Bitcoin and other blockchain networks.Beyond Dfns, Clarisse serves on the board of the MPC Alliance, mentors founders through Techstars Web3 Launchpad, and advises early-stage crypto startups at Station F, helping bridge traditional finance and decentralized systems.Before founding Dfns, Clarisse earned degrees in Geopolitics and History (Sorbonne), Finance (Sciences Po), and Applied Economics (Dauphine University). She spent a decade in investment banking at Goldman Sachs, Merrill Lynch, and Crédit Agricole CIB, where she became the youngest Chief of Staff to the CEO and led initiatives in research, global coverage, and energy innovation.Today, Clarisse is deeply engaged in expanding Bitcoin’s institutional adoption and ensuring secure, global access to self-custody infrastructure. She lives between New York and Paris with her partner, Christopher, and their two children.

name: Cody Carbone
title: CEO
biography: Cody Carbone is the CEO of The Digital Chamber, the world’s largest and most trusted trade association representing the digital asset and blockchain industry. Under Cody’s leadership, The Digital Chamber serves as the go-to resource for policymakers, regulators, and industry leaders seeking clarity and collaboration in the rapidly evolving world of digital assets.With over 200 members spanning the entire digital economy—from bitcoin miners and crypto exchanges to financial institutions and Fortune 500 companies—The Chamber plays a central role in shaping the future of Web3 policy. As the premier voice in Washington, The Chamber leads federal education and advocacy efforts, crafting legislation, informing regulatory frameworks, and building bipartisan coalitions to ensure the United States remains a global hub for digital innovation.Cody personally oversees the Chamber’s engagement with Congress and the Trump administration, offering insight and policy solutions that reflect the diverse and rapidly growing digital asset ecosystem. His efforts have helped influence the most consequential digital asset legislation in the U.S..Prior to joining The Digital Chamber, Cody spent six years at Ernst & Young’s (EY) Office of Public Policy, where he led federal advocacy on financial services and emerging technologies. He also brings significant legislative experience, having served as policy staff in both the U.S. House of Representatives and U.S. Senate.Cody holds a Juris Doctor (JD) and a Master of Public Administration (MPA) from Syracuse University and is admitted to the New York State Bar. He resides in Washington, D.C., where he continues to champion smart, innovation-forward policies for the digital future.

name: Dan Webb
title: Program Coordinator
biography: I've worked in Bitcoin as software engineer, marketer, and strategist for more than five years. Former co-host of the High Hash Rate podcast.

name: Daniel Batten
title: Managing Partner
biography: Daniel Batten is an entrepreneur and venture capitalist who become a significant voice in the Bitcoin space mainly through his data-driven approach to challenging common energy narratives.As these narratives have evolved he has pivoted attention to investigating the humanitarian value of Bitcoin, and its suitability on the balance sheet of large institutional capital

name: Daniel Jonsson
title: CEO
biography: Daniel is the CEO of newly launched mgmt Digital Infrastructure Fund, a fund focused on bitcoin mining where energy is low cost, stranded or curtailed and leveraging mining with additional revenue streams such as grid balancing and heat reuse in the Nordics and eventually throughout Europe.A passionate miner since 2017, Daniel has been active in the industry founding and leading companies such as Greenblocks, a bitcoin mining company and Viska Digital Assets, Iceland's first digital asset focused hedge fund.Daniel has been an active angel investor in recent years.As a firm believer in proof of work and doing hard things, Daniel can bench press 150kg and deadlift 221kg.

name: Daniel Sempere Pico
title: Chief Viral Officer
biography: I'm a former real estate broker and entrepreneur turned bitcoiner. I got seriously into bitcoin at the end of 2020. In early 2021, I started the Bitcoin Gandalf Twitter account and grew it from 0-80,000 followers in 3 years. I also worked in marketing at bitcoin mining company Braiins from 2021-2023. In addition to writing about bitcoin, I'm also focused on helping people become more sovereign by building their personal brands through my ghostwriting and personal branding strategy consulting services.

name: Danny Knowles
title: Host
biography: Host of What Bitcoin DidVenture Partner @ Epoch

name: Danny Yeung
title: Co-Founder & CEO
biography: Prenetics (Nasdaq: PRE) is a global health-tech and longevity company pioneering a dual-engine “Health + Wealth” strategy—building a transformative wellness brand while simultaneously accumulating one of the world’s most forward-leaning corporate Bitcoin treasuries.Its flagship brand IM8, co-founded with David Beckham, has become a category-defining force—achieving US$100M ARR in only 11 months, making it the fastest supplement company in history to reach this scale, even surpassing the growth trajectories of leading AI companies. IM8 is now projected to reach US$300M ARR by the end of 2026, powered by global expansion, strong clinical validation, and a world-class scientific advisory board.On the wealth engine, as of November 19, Prenetics holds 495 BTC and is acquiring 1 BTC per day, underscoring its commitment to long-term financial resilience, asymmetric upside, and a future where companies invest not only in extending lifespan, but also in strengthening financial health for decades to come.

name: Darius Alexander
title: Managing Director
biography: Darius is Managing Director at FTI Consulting. He advises multinationals and institutional funds on marcomms, GTM and growth strategy, having launched into the UAE many leading global technology, fintech and digital assets firms. Prior to FTI, Darius was in venture capital and fintech company building.

name: Dave Ripley
title: co-CEO
biography: David Ripley has served as Kraken's Co-Chief Executive Officer since October 2024. He previously served as Kraken's Chief Operating Officer from October 2016 to April 2023 and Chief Executive Officer from April 2023 to October 2024.Prior to joining Kraken, Mr. Ripley was the Co-Founder and Chief Executive Officer of Glidera, a non-custodial wallet and funding service provider that was acquired by Kraken in 2016.Mr. Ripley previously held roles in consulting at The Boston Consulting Group, where he advised clients across multiple industries, including technology and financial services. Earlier in his career, he also held management positions in software engineering and product management at Syclo, a mobile enterprise software company. Mr. Ripley holds a B.S. in Electrical Engineering from the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign and an M.B.A. from the Kellogg School of Management at Northwestern University.

name: David Bailey
title: CEO
biography: As the co-founder and chief executive officer of BTC Inc., David Bailey is an industry leader and evangelist for the decentralized future. Since 2013, BTC Inc has grown to offer critical intelligence, brand-building expertise and technical incubation specialized for the Bitcoin ecosystem, as well as industry-leading projects like Bitcoin Magazine, the Bitcoin 2022 conference, and Carrot. The company now operates in multiple countries and its brands are quickly becoming household names. Bailey sits on the board of advisors for the University of Alabama. He was managing partner at 402 Digital Partners, which is one of the earliest Bitcoin funds. He is currently general partner of UTXO Management; and is an active angel investor in the Bitcoin ecosystem.

name: Davinci Jeremie
title: CEO
biography: Davinci Jeremie is a Bitcoin educator and entrepreneur dedicated to making crypto simple and practical. He runs the B4B (Bitcoin for Beginners) program, hosts live workshops and mentorships, and produces clear, hands-on guidance on buying, securing and using Bitcoin and Lightning. His teaching focuses on real-world custody, seed security and helping newcomers build confidence with crypto.

name: Denny Xing
title: VP of Business Development
biography: Denny is currently the VP of Business Development at Hash House, where he leads business development, sales, and project management, driving growth and operational excellence across immersion and hydro cooling solutions and electrical hardware solutions.Prior to Hash House, Denny held key roles at Novablock, Poolin, and Luxor, where he developed expertise across multiple business verticals, including mining pool, firmware, hosting operations, and equipment financing.

name: Derar Islim
title: Antalpha's COO and CEO of Americas & EMEA
biography: Derar Islim, Ph.D. – Chief Operating Officer, Antalpha Platform Holding Company and CEO, Americas & EMEADerar Islim, PhD, is a seasoned financial executive with significant experience in the digital asset industry, building and managing premier digital assets financial services and products globally. Islim’s career reflects a blend of academic rigor and practical experience in high-stakes financial environments. Derar’s leadership at Genesis, particularly during its crisis, showcased his ability to navigate complex operational and financial challenges from execution and governance perspectives.Derar formerly held the roles of Interim CEO and COO at Genesis and, prior to that, Head of Risk at Hard Yaka. He has an established track record of leading at the forefront of modern financial markets. Early in his career, he served as a senior trader at Bank of America Merrill Lynch, where he co-managed the Funding Valuation Adjustment (FVA) trading desk and worked on modeling, pricing, and hedging credit structured products.Derar holds a Ph.D. in Financial Mathematics from Florida State University, focusing on financial derivatives and applied partial differential equations.Derar is a recipient of the prestigious Fulbright Scholarship, alongside other academic and professional awards.

name: Dishang Patel
title: Head of Digital Assets
biography: Leading the banking charge for RAKBANK in the world of Digital Assets. With a background in Banking, Consulting, and Venture, Dishang brings a very rounded perspective whilst considering DeFi enablement possibilities to TradFi environments.

name: Dylan LeClair
title: Head of Bitcoin Strategy
biography: Dylan LeClair leads Metaplanet’s corporate Bitcoin strategy, advancing its mission to integrate Bitcoin into the core of public capital markets.

name: Efe Kelemci
title: Co Founder
biography: Teen Bitcoiner, Macro Analyst and Educator

name: Eli Ben-Sasson
title: Co-Founder, CEO
biography: Eli is a co-founder and CEO of StarkWare, and Chairman of its Board of Directors.He has been researching cryptographic and zero knowledge proofs of computational integrity ever since he received his Phd in Theoretical Computer Science from the Hebrew University in 2001. Eli is a co-inventor of the STARK, FRI and Zerocash protocols and a Founding Scientist of the Zcash Company. Over the years he held research positions at the Institute for Advanced Study at Princeton, Harvard and MIT, and, most recently, was a Professor of CS at Technion, which he left to co-found StarkWare.

name: Eric Yakes
title: Managing Partner
biography: Eric Yakes is the Founder and Managing Partner of Epoch - a bitcoin infrastructure focused venture capital firm. He left the world of distressed private equity buyouts to join the bitcoin revolution by authoring The 7th Property - a best selling new release and internationally published book on bitcoin. As a CFA charter holder, his thought leadership is focused on the financial community helping them understand the revolutionary investment characteristics of bitcoin. Eric is a founding member and board Chairman of The Space - a Denver based non-profit educating the masses on economics and bitcoin.

name: Erik Hersman
title: CEO
biography: Erik Hersman is the CEO and co-founder of Gridless, a company building renewable energy mini-grids across Africa powered and stabilized by Bitcoin mining. Through projects in Kenya, Malawi, and Zambia, Gridless turns stranded or excess renewable power into productive local electricity and income for rural communities. A longtime technology entrepreneur and infrastructure builder, Erik’s work demonstrates how Bitcoin can be a catalyst for electrification, economic inclusion, and energy resilience across the continent.

name: Erik LaPaglia
title: Managing Partner
biography: Erik LaPaglia is an angel investor, serial entrepreneur, and advisor with a track record of building and revitalizing companies across technology, real estate, advertising, and finance. As co-founder of Miami NFT Week and a board member of multiple organizations, Erik has been deeply involved in bridging innovation with institutional capital, fostering global partnerships at the intersection of Web3, tokenization, and traditional finance.Known for his ability to identify emerging trends and unlock new growth opportunities, Erik has advised and invested in numerous ventures within the blockchain and real-world asset (RWA) tokenization space. He has shared the stage at premier events such as iConnections, SALT, NFT NYC, Bitcoin Conference, and the Benzinga Tech & Finance Conference, engaging audiences on topics ranging from crypto adoption to proptech and capital markets innovation.With a vast network that spans entrepreneurs, investors, and thought leaders, Erik brings a unique perspective on how technology can reshape industries and create scalable, lasting impact.

name: Fabian Jahr
title: Bitcoin Open Source Developer
biography: Fabian works on Bitcoin Core but also supports other related Bitcoin open source projects. He is also researching protocol innovations enabled by Schnorr signatures such as CISA.

name: Faisal Al Hammadi
title: Managing Partner
biography: All things Bitcoin

name: Faisal Saeed Al Mutar
title: Founder
biography: Faisal Saeed Al Mutar is a social entrepreneur and media executive with extensive experience in economic development, innovation, and leadership.Over the past decade, Faisal has driven large-scale change and fostered growth in the Middle East and beyond. As the founder of Ideas Beyond Borders, he has built the organization into a leading platform for advancing free market thought, innovation, and policy reform in the Arab world, particularly in Iraq.Al Mutar has collaborated with intergovernmental organizations and private-sector stakeholders to promote growth and entrepreneurship. His work focuses on identifying transformative opportunities in diverse societies and implementing actionable policies to create jobs, reduce bureaucracy, and empower businesses with the tools necessary to grow.A sought-after speaker and thought leader, Faisal has delivered talks on global platforms, including TED, and engaged with audiences across the U.S. and the Middle East. His expertise spans innovation, counter-extremism, and geopolitical stability. He also supports startups and aspiring leaders, helping empower the next generation of changemakers.Faisal received the President’s Volunteer Service Award from President Barack Obama and an honorary doctorate from Whittier College in California.Splitting his time between New York and the Middle East, Faisal blends global insights with local expertise, building bridges between cultures and advancing meaningful change.

name: Farooq Ahmed
title: Founder & CEO
biography: Passionate bitcoin maximalist from Pakistan, driving bitcoin adoption in Pakistan and the UAE. Founder of Bitcoin Pakistan, a non-profit dedicated to educating Pakistanis and muslims worldwide on bitcoin's power for financial sovereignty and wealth preservation.

name: Fin Creighton
title: Founder
biography: Fin Creighton is the founder of Bitcoin Success School. His work blends Bitcoin education, sovereignty, and long term protection, guiding individuals to avoid costly mistakes, remove trust in third parties, and take full control of their future. The Fin Creighton Podcast releases a weekly episode targeted for Gen Z Bitcoin Education.

name: Frank Corva
title: Political Correspondent
biography: Frank Corva is the White House and Political Correspondent for Bitcoin Magazine.

name: Fred King
title: Founder
biography: Fred King is a Bitcoiner and the founder of CryptoSnake, a YouTube channel focused on Bitcoin and crypto.

name: Gary Sheynkman
title: Partner
biography: Founder and VC

name: George Mekhail
title: Managing Director
biography: George Mekhail is the Managing Director of Bitcoin for Corporations at BTC Inc., author of I Am Not Your Bruh, and co-author of Thank God for Bitcoin. A passionate advocate for Bitcoin since 2017, George blends his experience in marketing, financial innovation, and community development to guide companies in thoughtfully integrating Bitcoin into their strategic operations, while also advocating for strong family dynamics at home.

name: Gopal Bharvad
title: Founder & COO
biography: Building Bitcoin Financial Services @ HedgitWhile shaping the Orange Hill @ 21mStarted mining in 2014, burned down old refrigerator trying to cool a rig and hosted a Bitcoin meetup in 2016 then Shitereum happened. Since then been on the learning curve, educating about corn, building & growing while eternally repeating: Stack the sats.

name: Greg Carson
title: Managing Partner
biography: Greg Carson is a frequent contributor, lecturer and speaker on events about investing in the digital asset ecosystem and negotiation technique. He has spoken on these subjects at several global conferences including Super Venture, Wyoming Blockchain Symposium, CFC St Moritz, Bitcoin 2021-2025, MCC, Davos, Uncorrelated Alts, Horizon events and even at his Alma Mater, the Wharton School of Business. Greg has a decade as a tech founder, a decade of experience in investment banking and strategy, and is rounding out his first decade in venture capital. Humla Ventures operates in the top decile of venture returns and is one of the top global emerging managers in the space. Greg is a dedicated father snowboarder, sportsman, reader/writer, dance teacher and tai chi.

name: Gregg Davis
title: Director MENA
biography: UK national, based in the UAE for 10 years. Having attended and had poor experiences at crypto events in the region, Gregg reached out to BTC Inc in 2022 to bring the Bitcoin Conference to Abu Dhabi. Using the landmark success of the inaugural Bitcoin MENA conference in 2024 as a launchpad, Gregg is now working on a bigger and better Bitcoin MENA 2025 along with launching Bitcoin Magazine, Bitcoin for Corporations and UTXO Managment into the GCC region. Yacht Captain by trade, Bitcoiner by nature.

name: Haider Rafique
title: Managing Partner and CMO
biography: Haider Rafique is the Global Managing Partner and Chief Marketing Officer at OKX, where he oversees government and investor relations, marketing, and brand partnerships. He plays a central role in shaping OKX’s engagement with global regulators, investors, and key stakeholders during a pivotal time for the cryptocurrency industry. Haider is also the creator of the OKX brand, and led its transformation into a globally recognized platform and was a key contributor developing the OKX app as a unified crypto super app.Prior to joining OKX, he led the rebranding and growth of blockchain.info into blockchain.com, one of the leading digital asset platforms. He has held senior marketing and growth roles at major crypto firms, including Okcoin, where he drove significant retail user growth. Haider’s experience spans traditional advertising with global agencies and technology companies such as Microsoft.

name: Henson Orser
title: Founder & CEO
biography: Prior to launching Soter Insure, Henson was the first CEO of the Virtual Asset Regulator Authority in Dubai (VARA), and prior to that he was President and Acting CEO of Komainu, an institutional grade digital asset custodian, launched out of Nomura Securities in collaboration with Coinshares and Ledger.

name: Hicham Chahine
title: Founder & Co-CEO
biography: Hicham Chahine is Co-Founder and Co-CEO of NIP Group (NASDAQ: NIPG), where he is leading the company's rapid expansion into Bitcoin mining and digital infrastructure. Under his leadership, NIPG scaled from zero to 11.3 EH/s of Bitcoin mining capacity in under six months, establishing the company as one of the fastest-growing public miners globally, and the largest in the MENA region.Prior to NIPG's digital infrastructure expansion, Hicham acquired the esports organization Ninjas in Pyjamas in 2016 and built it into a global gaming and entertainment platform reaching hundreds of millions of fans. His background spans finance and entrepreneurship - from 2008 to 2016, he directed hedge fund investments at Formue, the Nordic region's largest wealth management firm, and in 2010 founded Diglife AS, a private equity firm focused on lifestyle, gaming, and technology investments.Hicham brings a unique perspective to Bitcoin mining through his combination of financial markets experience, operational scale-up expertise, and deep understanding of digital communities and fan engagement. He is based in Abu Dhabi, where NIPG operates under a partnership framework with the Abu Dhabi Investment Office. He holds a bachelor's degree in business and economics from BI Norwegian Business School.

name: Hubertus "the Austrian" Hofkirchner
title: Founder
biography: Hubertus is the Founder of Bitcredit Protocol, the elastic Bitcoin credit money layer for business adoption in the real economy. A former commercial banker, investment banker, and Telecom CEO, Hubertus has been an independent serial entrepreneur at the intersection of finance and IT for two decades, founding an online brokerage, a digital options exchange, and a global prediction market platform. He also hosts the monthly Austrian Economics Salon at Vienna's Hayek Institute.

name: Hunter Albright
title: Chief Revenue Officer
biography: Hunter is the Chief Revenue Officer of SALT Lending, one of the earliest Bitcoin-backed lending platforms, and co-author of the upcoming book - The Bitcoin Advantage. A systems engineer by training with a Ph.D. in optimization and AI from the University of Virginia, he has held senior leadership roles at global banks include Barclays, HBOS, and MasterCard, founded and advised multiple startups, and worked internationally across Europe and the U.S. Hunter has been active in Bitcoin education through the University of Colorado Blockchain Alliance, IEEE blockchain initiatives, and the CryptoCurrency Certification Consortium (C4), and he frequently speaks at global Bitcoin conferences on innovation in Bitcoin-backed finance and financial sovereignty.

name: Ian Dillon
title: CEO
biography: Ian is an executive and serial entrepreneur, building businesses providing financial services to underserved groups in the Middle East and Africa. Ian is currently CEO of Sumara Technology, which undertakes digital transformation projects for large financial services firms. Sumara Technology has a Bitcoin treasury, and uses this as a competitive advantage.Former Chief Product Officer at Moniepoint, the second fastest growing company in Africa, Global Head of Product at CMC Markets, and co-founder of NOW Money, a multiple award winning UAE-based company that broke new ground by providing accounts and access to financial services for the 26 million migrant workers in the Middle East.Ian was UAE Fintech Entrepreneur of the Year 2019 (ADGM).Ian is an avid Bitcoiner, who is working on solutions that can bring the benefits of Bitcoin to populations in Africa and the Middle East, who have unique characteristics and needs from financial services which are often poorly understood by the West.

name: Irene Gao
title: President of Mining
biography: Irene has years of experience in the digital currency mining space and is in charge of BITMAIN’s global business development. She is an expert on developing the mining ecosystem with vast knowledge of high-performance mining hardware and data center development. She is an advocate for renewable energy integration for green mining.

name: Irina Heaver
title: UAE’s Bitcoin Lawyer, Founder
biography: Irina Heaver is a leading Bitcoin lawyer based in Dubai, managing the first UAE-based law firm exclusively dedicated to Bitcoin and Crypto since 2016. She has represented some of the industry’s most prominent companies and groundbreaking projects. Irina has also advised numerous governments and regulators, playing a key role in shaping emerging technology policies and drafting Bitcoin-specific laws and regulations. Passionate about empowering visionary startup founders, Irina is dedicated to helping them bring their innovative ideas to life. As a Bitcoiner, she firmly believes that money should be separated from the state.

name: JD Gagnon
title: Founder / President
biography: JD Gagnon is a blockchain entrepreneur and strategist with expertise across multiple ecosystems, most recently including the Core Network. As Founder of BITS (bits.financial), he develops infrastructure that bridges traditional finance and DeFi, supporting real-yield strategies with institutional-grade custody and cross-chain composability for assets like BTC and wBTC. A co-founder of Rome Blockchain Labs, an incubator focused on DeFi innovation, and BENQI, a lending protocol on Avalanche that reached $4B in TVL post-launch, JD has experience scaling protocols from early-stage development to enterprise adoption. His background in financial planning, business consulting, and digital strategy helps him address risks, regulations, and opportunities with institutions and projects of all sizes.

name: Jez Mohideen
title: Co-founder & CEO
biography: Dr. Jez Mohideen is an accomplished entrepreneur and financial innovator, recognized for building businesses at the intersection of traditional finance and digital assets. As Co-Founder & CEO of Laser Digital — the digital finance arm of Nomura Group, he is leading thecreation of regulated, institutional-grade solutions across trading, asset management, and venture investment in the digital asset ecosystem.An entrepreneur at heart, Jez has co-founded and scaled ventures including Komainu, an institutional digital asset custodian launched with Nomura in 2018, and KAIO (formerly Libre), a pioneer in tokenisation infrastructure for real-world assets. Prior to Nomura, he was a partner at Brevan Howard, spearheading systematic and AI/ML-driven macro tradingstrategies.With over 30 years in global capital markets and macro trading, Jez also served as Nomura’s Chief Digital Officer and Co-Head of Global Markets EMEA, driving the firm’s digital transformation. He holds a PhD in Process Systems Engineering and a Master’s in Chemical Engineering from Imperial College London.

name: Jimmy Kostro
title: Co-Founder
biography: Asia’s fastest growing physical Bitcoin community

name: John Pratt
title: Co founder and host
biography: JP has been studying Bitcoin for 12 years and from 2018, co-founded and hosts Bitcoin Sydney, an educational and social group focused on helping existing Bitcoiners and general public understand and get involved in this burgeoning ecosystem. He also presents talks to other community groups on the necessity of owning Bitcoin.His other topics of interest include Bitcoin Game Theory, Bitcoin as sound money/savings tech, Bitcoin satellite connected nodes (first to run one in Aus), Why Bitcoin is the only blockchain that matters, and Bitcoin history.

name: Jonathan Ovadia
title: CEO
biography: As the Founder and CEO of OVEX, Jonathan Ovadia is at the forefront of institutional Bitcoin adoption in Africa.With a strong background in Electrical and Computer Engineering from the University of Cape Town, Jonathan views market inefficiencies as engineering problems—and has built OVEX into the region's premier infrastructure for digital asset settlement and liquidity.Jonathan is widely recognized for democratizing access to global finance for the continent's largest enterprises. He has been instrumental in opening up institutional access to Bitcoin, establishing the secure, high-volume payment rails required for companies to use cryptocurrency as a real-time settlement layer for cross-border trade and corporate treasury management. Having processed billions in volume, Jonathan is re-defining the utility of Bitcoin and stablecoins for African commerce.

name: Joseph Collement
title: Chief Legal Officer and Head of Media
biography: Joseph is a licensed attorney in the U.S. and founder of thecryptolawyers.com (est. 2017), a crypto-only law firm where he represented top players in the industry. Joseph has been an executive at Bitcoin.com since 2020 and leads the media, legal and compliance teams. Joseph is also a regular contributor to various financial and crypto online publications such as Coindesk, Fortune, Yahoo Finance, and Cointelegraph.

name: Joseph Dallago
title: CEO & Co-Founder
biography: Joseph Dallago is the Co-Founder and CEO of Rain, the first licensed and largest region-born cryptocurrency exchange in the Middle East and North Africa. He began coding at age 13 and has spent more than a decade building technology companies, founding and exiting two startups before Rain. Joseph entered the crypto space in 2013 and has been closely involved in its evolution, particularly across the Middle East. Under his leadership, Rain secured the region’s first crypto license with the Central Bank of Bahrain in 2017 and expanded its regulatory footprint by obtaining an ADGM licence in 2023. Rain has since grown to more than one million sign-ups and raised 110 million USD from global investors including Coinbase, Kleiner Perkins, and Paradigm. Joseph remains focused on expanding financial access and driving responsible crypto adoption across the region.

name: Joshua  Wiltord Mutekanga
title: Country Lead- Uganda
biography: Bitcoin advocate at the Bitcoin Innovation Hub in Uganda, where I lead Bitcoin education and adoption through programs that empower refugees.

name: Kevin  Zhang
title: Head of Asia
biography: As Head of Asia, Kevin will lead Nakamoto, which is a subsidiary of KindlyMD, Bitcoin treasury strategy across one of the world’s most important and dynamic regions. Kevin is responsible cultivating key relationships with governments, regulators, exchanges, and public companies, while also strengthening ties with institutional investors, sovereign funds, and family offices.Kevin first entered the Bitcoin space in 2014 and has spent the past decade at the forefront of mining and infrastructure deployment. Previously, he served as SVP of Business Development and Mining Strategies at Foundry Digital. At Foundry, Kevin oversaw the deployment of one of the largest North American fleets and helped build the world’s largest Bitcoin mining pool for four consecutive years.Prior to joining Foundry Digital, Kevin served as Chief Mining Officer at Greenidge Generation, where he transformed a 106MW natural gas plant into the first federally regulated power plant to mine Bitcoin, paving the way for broader institutional adoption of mining in the U.S. Before that, he served as Mining Operations Manager at Bitcoin.com. In 2016, he co-founded Project Spokane, a Bitcoin mining datacenter that he helped establish as the largest mining facility in North America at the time.

name: Kgothatso Ngako
title: CEO
biography: Kgothatso Ngako is a catalyst, accelerating the adoption of Bitcoin across the African continent.He has founded 8333.mobi, a wallet focused on giving people without an internet connected device the ability to send and receive Bitcoin (primarily through USSD), and exonumia.africa (focused on translating Bitcoin literature into African languages).

name: Khalil Nur Khalil
title: Chief Economic Adviser
biography: Khalil serves as the Economic Advisor to the Katsina State Government in Nigeria, and previously as the Executive Director of the Kaduna State Investment Promotion Agency in Nigeria. He is a passionate longtime Bitcoin advocate championing innovative economic policies and state-level strategies at the intersection of governance and Bitcoin in emerging markets

name: Khing Oei
title: CEO
biography: Khing Oei is the Founder and CEO of Treasury, a Netherlands-based Bitcoin treasury company recently launched with the ambition to become Europe’s largest. Backed by investors including Winklevoss Capital and Nakamoto, Treasury has the intention to list via a reverse listing on Euronext Amsterdam.

name: Kingsley Advani
title: CEO
biography: Kingsley Advani is CEO of Allocations, CEO of Allo, Managing Partner of Chainfund Capital and has managed $1BN+ in crypto assets spanning private and public markets across multiple funds since 2013 and structured $2BN+ of private equity transactions. Previously, Kingsley was a Mergers & Acquisitions (M&A) investment banker at BNP Paribas in London where he advised on $10bn+ of debt financing transactions. Kingsley was an early / seed investor in a number of crypto unicorns including Ethereum, Solana, Polkadot, Avalanche, Arweave, Oasis, Coinbase and Robinhood. He has invested in multiple digital asset treasury companies including: BNC Network Company (NASDAQ: BNC), Nakamoto (NASDAQ: NAKA), SUI Group Holdings Limited (NASDAQ: SUIG), TON Strategy Company (NASDAQ: TONX), Satsuma Technology PLC (LSE: SATS), ETHZilla Corporation (NASDAQ: ETHZ) and Forward Industries, Inc. (NASDAQ: FORD).

name: Kristyna Mazankova
title: Head of PR, Director of the Master in Bitcoin
biography: Kristýna Mazánková is the Director of the Master in Bitcoin — the world’s first English and global academic program dedicated entirely and only to Bitcoin as a social, technological, and economic phenomenon.Before entering the Bitcoin industry in 2019, Kristýna built her career in technology and corporate communications, helping global and regional organizations communicate innovation and navigate change. She later led communications at SatoshiLabs, the creators of Trezor, and today serves as Head of PR at BTC Inc., the company behind Bitcoin Magazine and the world’s largest Bitcoin conferences.At Hesperides University, Kristýna is shaping a new kind of higher education — one that treats Bitcoin not as a trend, but as a turning point in human organization, value, and trust. As she puts it, “Bitcoin deserves an academic space — serious, independent, and global.”Her work connects communication, education, technology, and the growing movement for intellectual and financial independence.

name: Laura Inamedinova
title: CGEO
biography: Laura K. Inamedinova is an award-winning serial entrepreneur, investor, and keynote speaker sharing her insights on the Web3 and Bitcoin space since 2016.As CGEO at Gate.com, she builds cross-border partnerships and manages the global growth of the exchange, with a strong focus on advancing Bitcoin adoption and access worldwide.Before joining Gate.com, she founded a Web3 marketing agency, LKI Consulting, which she grew to 8-figures. This led her to be globally acclaimed as one of the “10 Women Entrepreneurs” by Entrepreneur Magazine and among the “Top 10 Women in International Business” by Silicon Valley Times.In 2024, she transferred the leadership of LKI Consulting to a new management team, while Laura remained the majority shareholder.Laura was recognized as one of the “Forbes 30 Under 30 Blockchain Visionaries” by Forbes Mexico in 2025, highlighting her impact on the Web3 and Bitcoin industry.On a personal level, Laura is a successful angel investor with 40+ projects in her portfolio, an ex-Forbes and Huffington Post columnist, and an internationally renowned speaker who frequently covers Bitcoin’s role in shaping the future of finance.

name: Leeor Groen
title: Partner
biography: Leeor Groen is a Partner at Spartan Group based in Switzerland and active in the industry since 2016. He brings over ten years of experience in dealmaking, investing in, and advising technology companies across Europe, North America and Asia. At Spartan, Leeor works closely with founders, investors, and protocols across the digital asset ecosystem, helping them navigate strategic growth, capital raising, and exits.

name: Lena Art
title: Founder
biography: Style is a way to say who you are without having to speak.

name: Lina Seiche
title: CEO
biography: Lina Seiche is a cartoonist, writer, and creator of The Little HODLer, one of the world’s most popular Bitcoin comic and merchandise brands. Since 2020, The Little HODLer comic series has reached millions of readers online and in print; The Little HODLer plushies, comic books, and other merchandise have been adopted by customers in over 60 countries.
